SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (a) For the purposes of this section the following definitions apply.

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (1) Life limited part means any part for which a mandatory replacement limit is specified in the type design, the Instructions for Continued Airworthiness (ICA), or the maintenance manual.

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (2) Life status means the accumulated cycles, hours, or any other mandatory replacement limit of a life limited part.

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(b) Temporary removal of parts from type certificated products. When a life limited part is
temporarily removed and reinstalled for the purpose of performing maintenance, no disposition under paragraph (c) of this section is required if—

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (1) The life status of the part has not changed;

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (2) The removal and reinstallation is performed on the same serial numbered product; and

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (3) That product does not accumulate time in service while the part is removed.

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (c) Disposition of parts removed from type certificated products. Except as provided in paragraph (b) of this section, each person who removes a life limited part from a type certificated product must ensure the part is controlled using one of the methods in this paragraph. The method must deter the installation of the part after it has reached its life limit. Acceptable methods include:

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(1) Record keeping system. The part may be controlled using a record keeping system that
substantiates the part number, serial number, and current life status of the part. Each time the part is removed from a type certificated product, the record must be updated with the current life status. This system may include electronic, paper, or other means of record keeping.

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (2) Tag or record attached to part. A tag or other record may be attached to the part. The tag or record must include the part number, serial number, and current life status of the part. Each time the part is removed from a type certificated product, either a new tag or record must be created, or the existing tag or record must be updated with the current life status.

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (3) Non-permanent marking. The part may be legibly marked using a non permanent method showing its current life status. The life status must be updated each time the part is removed from a type certificated product, or if the mark is removed, another method in this section may be used. The mark must be accomplished in accordance with the instructions under GACAR § 45.16 in order to maintain the integrity of the part.

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (4) Permanent marking. The part may be legibly marked using a permanent method showing its current life status. The life status must be updated each time the part is removed from a type certificated product. Unless the part is permanently removed from use on type certificated products, this permanent mark must be accomplished in accordance with the instructions under GACAR § 45.16 in order to maintain the integrity of the part.

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (5) Segregation. The part may be segregated using methods, which deter its installation on a type certificated product. These methods must include, at least—

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (i) Maintaining a record of the part number, serial number, and current life status, and

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(ii) Ensuring the part is physically stored separately from parts currently eligible for
installation.

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (6) Mutilation. The part may be mutilated to deter its installation in a type certificated product. The mutilation must render the part beyond repair and incapable of being reworked to appear to be airworthy.

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (7) Other methods. Any other method approved or accepted by the President.

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Disposition of Life Limited Aircraft Parts.
REGULATION STATEMENT: (d) Transfer of life limited parts. Each person who removes a life limited part from a type certificated product and later sells or otherwise transfers that part must transfer with the part the mark, tag, or other record used to comply with this section, unless the part is mutilated before it is sold or transferred.

REGULATION STATEMENT: (b) Listing of discrepancies and placards. If the person performing any inspection required by GACAR Part 91, Part 125, Part 133 or GACAR § 135.239(a)(1) finds the aircraft is not airworthy or does not meet the applicable type certificate data, airworthiness directives, or other approved data upon which its airworthiness depends, that person must give the owner or lessee a signed and dated list of those discrepancies. For those items permitted to be inoperative under GACAR § 91.309(d)(2), that person must place a placard, which meets the aircraft’s airworthiness certification regulations, on each inoperative instrument and the cockpit control of each item of inoperative equipment, marking it “Inoperative,” and must add the items to the signed and dated list of discrepancies given to the owner or lessee.

REGULATION STATEMENT: (b) The commission by any person of an act prohibited under paragraph (a) of this section is a basis for suspending or revoking the applicable airman, operator, SATSOA or SAPMA issued by the President and held by that person.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(a) Each person performing maintenance, alteration, or preventive maintenance on an aircraft, engine, propeller, or appliance must use the methods, techniques, and practices prescribed in the current manufacturer’s maintenance manual or ICA prepared by its manufacturer, or other methods, techniques, and practices acceptable to the President, except as noted in GACAR § 43.25. He must use the tools, equipment, and test apparatus necessary to assure completion of the work in accordance with accepted industry practices. If special equipment or test apparatus is recommended by the manufacturer involved, he must use that equipment or apparatus or its equivalent acceptable to
the President.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (b) Each person maintaining or altering, or performing preventive maintenance, must do that work in such a manner and use materials of such a quality, that the condition of the aircraft, airframe, aircraft engine, propeller, or appliance worked on will be at least equal to its original or properly altered condition (with regard to aerodynamic function, structural strength, resistance to vibration and deterioration, and other qualities affecting airworthiness).

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (c) Special provisions for holders of air operator certificates and operator certificates issued for operations under the provisions of GACAR Part 121 or 135. Unless otherwise notified by the President, the methods, techniques, and practices contained in the maintenance manual or the maintenance part of the manual of the holder of an air operator certificate under GACAR Parts 121 or 135,that is required by its operating specifications to provide a continuous airworthiness maintenance and inspection program, constitute acceptable means of compliance with this section

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Additional Performance Rules for Alterations and Repairs
REGULATION STATEMENT: (a) Each person performing an alteration or repair must perform the alteration or repair in accordance with approved data.

SUBPART HEADING: General
SUBPART SECTION HEADING: Additional Performance Rules for Alterations and Repairs
REGULATION STATEMENT: (b) Each person performing a major alteration or major repair as established in accordance with Appendix A of this part, must record the major alteration or major repair in accordance with the provisions of Appendix B of this part.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (a) General. Each person performing an inspection required by GACAR Part 91, 125, 133, or 135, must—

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (1) Perform the inspection so as to determine whether the aircraft, or portion(s) thereof under inspection, meets all applicable airworthiness requirements; and

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (2) If the inspection is one provided for in GACAR Part 125, 133, 135, or GACAR § 91.449(e), perform the inspection in accordance with the instructions and procedures set forth in the inspection program for the aircraft being inspected.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (b) Rotorcraft. Each person performing an inspection required by GACAR Part 91 on a rotorcraft must inspect the following systems in accordance with the maintenance manual or ICA of the manufacturer concerned:

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (1) The drive shafts or similar systems.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (2) The main rotor transmission gear box for obvious defects.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (3) The main rotor and center section (or the equivalent area).

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (4) The auxiliary rotor on helicopters.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (c) Annual and 100 hour inspections.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(1) Each person performing an annual or 100 hour inspection must use a checklist while
performing the inspection. The checklist may be of the person’s own design, one provided by the manufacturer of the equipment being inspected, or one obtained from another source. This checklist must include the scope and detail of the items contained in Appendix D of this part and paragraph (b) of this section.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (2) Each person before approving a reciprocating engine powered aircraft for return to service after an annual or 100 hour inspection must run the aircraft engine or engines to determine satisfactory performance in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations of—

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (i) Power output (static and idle rpm);

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (ii) Magnetos;

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iii) Fuel and oil pressure; and

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iv) Cylinder and oil temperature.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (3) Each person before approving a turbine engine powered aircraft for return to service after an annual, 100 hour, or progressive inspection must run the aircraft engine or engines to determine satisfactory performance in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT: (d) Progressive inspection.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(1) Each person performing a progressive inspection must begin by inspecting the aircraft
completely. After this initial inspection, routine and detailed inspections must be conducted as prescribed in the progressive inspection schedule. Routine inspections consist of visual examination or check of the appliances, the aircraft, and its components and systems, insofar as practicable without disassembly. Detailed inspections consist of a thorough examination of the appliances, the aircraft, and its components and systems, with such disassembly as is necessary. For the purposes of this subparagraph, the overhaul of a component or system is considered a detailed inspection.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(2) If the aircraft is away from the station where inspections are normally conducted, an
appropriately rated mechanic, a certificated repair station, or the manufacturer of the aircraft may perform inspections in accordance with the procedures and using the forms of the person who would otherwise perform the inspection.

SUBPART HEADING: General
REGULATION STATEMENT:
Each person performing an inspection or other maintenance specified in an Airworthiness
Limitations section of a manufacturer’s maintenance manual or ICA must perform the inspection or other maintenance in accordance with that section, or in accordance with operations specifications approved by the President under GACAR Part 121 or 135, or an inspection program approved under GACAR § 91.449(e).

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (1) General: A major alteration is any alteration that would reduce the capability of aircraft or ability of the crew to cope with adverse operating conditions or prevent continued safe flight and landing—

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (i) If it were accomplished incorrectly;

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (ii) If it failed;

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iii) If it malfunctioned; or

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iv) If it otherwise could create an unsafe condition.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(2) Airframe major alterations. Alterations of the following parts and alterations of the
following types, when not listed in the approved aircraft specifications, are airframe major
alterations:

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (i) Wings.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (ii) Tail surfaces.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iii) Fuselage.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iv) Engine mounts.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (v) Control system.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (vi) Landing gear.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (vii) Hull or floats.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(viii) Elements of an airframe including spars, ribs, fittings, shock absorbers, bracing,
cowlings, fairings, and balance weights.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (ix) Hydraulic and electrical actuating system of components.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (x) Rotor blades.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xi) Changes to the empty mass or empty balance which result in an increase in the maximum certificated mass or center of gravity limits of the aircraft.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(xii) Changes to the basic design of the fuel, oil, cooling, heating, cabin pressurization,
electrical, hydraulic, deicing, or exhaust systems.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(xiii) Changes to the wing or to fixed or movable control surfaces, which affect flutter and
vibration characteristics.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (3) Powerplant major alterations. The following alterations of a powerplant, when not listed in the approved engine specifications, are powerplant major alterations:

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(i) Conversion of an aircraft engine from one approved model to another, involving any
changes in compression ratio, propeller reduction gear, impeller gear ratios or the
substitution of major engine parts which requires extensive rework and testing of the
engine.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(ii) Changes to the engine by replacing aircraft engine structural parts with parts not
supplied by the original manufacturer or parts not specifically approved by the President.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iii) Installation of an accessory, which is not approved for the engine.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(iv) Removal of accessories listed as required equipment on the aircraft or engine
specification.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (v) Installation of structural parts other than the type of parts approved for the installation.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(vi) Conversions of any sort for using fuel of a rating or grade other than that listed in the
engine specifications.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (4) Propeller major alterations. The following alterations of a propeller when not authorized in the approved propeller specifications are propeller major alterations:

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (i) Changes in blade design.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (ii) Changes in hub design.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iii) Changes in the governor or control design.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iv) Installation of a propeller governor or feathering system.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (v) Installation of propeller deicing system.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (vi) Installation of parts not approved for the propeller.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (5) Appliance major alterations. Alterations of the basic design not made in accordance with recommendations of the appliance manufacturer or in accordance with an airworthiness directive are appliance major alterations. In addition, changes in the basic design of radio communication and navigation equipment approved under type certification or a technical standard order having an effect on frequency stability, noise level, sensitivity, selectivity, distortion, spurious radiation, Active Vibration Control characteristics, or ability to meet environmental test conditions, and other changes having an effect on the performance of the equipment are also major alterations.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (1) General. A major repair is any repair that would reduce the capability of aircraft or ability of the crew to cope with adverse operating conditions or prevent continued safe flight and landing—

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (i) If it were accomplished incorrectly;

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (ii) If it failed;

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iii) If it otherwise could create an unsafe condition.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(2) Airframe major repairs. Repairs to the following parts of an airframe and repairs of the
following types, involving the strengthening, reinforcing, splicing, and manufacturing of
primary structural members or their replacement, when replacement is by fabrication such as riveting or welding, are airframe major repairs:

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (i) Box beams.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (ii) Monocoque or semimonocoque wings or control surfaces.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iii) Wing stringers or chord members.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iv) Spars.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (v) Spar flanges.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (vi) Members of truss-type beams.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (vii) Thin sheet webs of beams.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (viii) Keel and chine members of boat hulls or floats.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(ix) Corrugated sheet compression members, which act as flange material of wings or tail
surfaces.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (x) Wing main ribs and compression members.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xi) Wing or tail surface brace struts.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xii) Engine mounts.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xiii) Fuselage longerons.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xiv) Members of the side truss, horizontal truss, or bulkheads.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xv) Main seat support braces and brackets.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xvi) Landing gear brace struts.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xvii) Axles.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xviii) Wheels.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xix) Skis, and ski pedestals.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xx) Parts of the control system such as control columns, pedals, shafts, brackets, or horns.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xxi) Repairs involving the substitution of material.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(xxii) The repair of damaged areas in metal or plywood stressed covering exceeding 6 in
(152 mm) in any direction.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xxiii) The repair of portions of skin sheets by making additional seams.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xxiv) The splicing of skin sheets.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xxv) The repair of three or more adjacent wing or control surface ribs or the leading edge of wings and control surfaces, between such adjacent ribs.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(xxvi) Repair of fabric covering involving an area greater than that required to repair two
adjacent ribs.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(xxvii) Replacement of fabric on fabric covered parts such as wings, fuselages, stabilizers,
and control surfaces.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (xxviii) Repairing, including rebottoming, of removable or integral fuel tanks and oil tanks.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(3) Powerplant major repairs. Repairs of the following parts of an engine and repairs of the
following types, are powerplant major repairs:

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(i) Separation or disassembly of a crankcase or crankshaft of a reciprocating engine
equipped with an integral supercharger.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(ii) Separation or disassembly of a crankcase or crankshaft of a reciprocating engine
equipped with other than spur-type propeller reduction gearing.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(iii) Special repairs to structural engine parts by welding, plating, metalizing, or other
methods

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (4) Turbine engine part classifications.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(i) General. Below are classifications of turbine engine structural parts and the general
classifications of engine repairs. Although each manufacturer may not use the identical
terminology used below, what they use must be equivalent to the following:

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (A) All frames.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (B) All casings/housings.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (C) Engine mounts and associated engine structures.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (D) Complete rotor assemblies.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iii) Engine frames include the following:

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (A) Front frames or front bearing support.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (B) Compressor rear frame.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (C) Turbine mid-frame.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance

REGULATION STATEMENT: (C) Combustor casing/housing.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (D) Turbine casing/housing.

REGULATION STATEMENT: (E) Accessory gear-case housing.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (5) The following will apply to modular designed turbine engines, non-modular designed turbine engines, and reciprocating engines, as applicable:

REGULATION STATEMENT: (i) Modular Design Turbine Engines. The following repair classifications will apply:

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (A) Welding of crankcases.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix A to GACAR Part 43 Major Aletrations, Major Repairs, and Preventive Maintenance
REGULATION STATEMENT: (B) Machining operations necessitated by a weld repair.

REGULATION STATEMENT: (C) Crankshaft grinding.

REGULATION STATEMENT: Each person performing the altimeter system tests and inspections required by GACAR § 91.451 must comply with the following:

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: (a) Static pressure system

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: (1) Ensure freedom from entrapped moisture and restrictions.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(2) Determine leakage is within the tolerances established in GACAR §§ 23.1325 or 25.1325,
whichever is applicable.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: (3) Determine the static port heater, if installed, is operative.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: (4) Ensure no alterations or deformations of the airframe surface have been made that would affect the relationship between air pressure in the static pressure system and true ambient static air pressure for any flight condition.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: (b) Altimeter:

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(1) Test by an appropriately rated repair facility in accordance with the following
subparagraphs. Unless otherwise specified, each test for performance may be conducted with the instrument subjected to vibration. When tests are conducted with the temperature substantially different from ambient temperature of approximately 25 °C, allowance must be made for the variation from the specified condition.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(i) Scale error. With the barometric pressure scale at 10 132.1 hPa, the altimeter must be
subjected successively to pressures corresponding to the altitude specified in Table D–1
up to the maximum normally expected operating altitude of the aircraft in which the altimeter is to be installed. The reduction in pressure must be made at a rate not in excess of 20 000 ft (6 096 m) per minute to within approximately 2 000 ft (609.6 m) of the test point. The test point must be approached at a rate compatible with the test equipment. The altimeter must be kept at the pressure corresponding to each test point for at least 1 minute, but not more than 10 minutes, before a reading is taken. The error at all test points must not exceed the Jtolerances specified in Table D–1.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: (ii) Hysteresis. The hysteresis test must begin not more than 15 minutes after the altimeter’s initial exposure to the pressure corresponding to the upper limit of the scale error test prescribed in paragraph (b)(1)(i) of this appendix; and while the altimeter is at this pressure, the hysteresis test must commence. Pressure must be increased at a rate simulating a descent in altitude at the rate of 5 000 to 20 000 ft (1 524 to 6 096 m) per minute until within 3 000 ft (914.4 m) of the first test point (50 percent of maximum altitude). The test point must then be approached at a rate of approximately 3 000 ft (914.4 m) per minute. The altimeter must be kept at this pressure for at least 5 minutes, but not more than 15 minutes, before the test reading is taken. After the reading has been taken, the pressure must be increased further, in the same manner as before, until the pressure corresponding to the second test point (40 percent of maximum altitude) is reached. The altimeter must be kept at this pressure for at least 1 minute, but not more than 10 minutes, before the test reading is taken. After the reading has been taken, the pressure must be increased further, in the same manner as before, until atmospheric pressure is reached. The reading of the altimeter at either of the two test points must not differ by more than the tolerance specified in Table D–2 from the reading of the altimeter for the corresponding altitude recorded during the scale error test prescribed in paragraph (b)(1)(i) of this appendix.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(iii) After effect. Not more than 5 minutes after the completion of the hysteresis test
prescribed in paragraph (b)(1)(ii) of this appendix, the reading of the altimeter (corrected for any change in atmospheric pressure) must not differ from the original atmospheric pressure reading by more than the tolerance specified in Table D–2.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(iv) Friction. The altimeter must be subjected to a steady rate of decrease of pressure
approximating 750 ft (226 m) per minute. At each altitude listed in Table D–3, the change in reading of the pointers after vibration must not exceed the corresponding tolerance listed in Table D–3.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: (v) Case leak. The leakage of the altimeter case, when the pressure within it corresponds to an altitude of 18 000 ft (5 486 m), must not change the altimeter reading by more than the tolerance shown in Table D–2 during an interval of 1 minute.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(vi) Barometric scale error. At constant atmospheric pressure, the barometric pressure
scale must be set at each of the pressures (falling within its range of adjustment) listed in
Table D–4, and must cause the pointer to indicate the equivalent altitude difference shown in Table D–4 with a tolerance of 25 ft (7.6 m).

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: (c) Automatic pressure altitude reporting equipment and ATC transponder system integration test. The test must be conducted by an appropriately rated person under the conditions specified in paragraph (a) of this appendix. Measure the automatic pressure altitude at the output of the installed ATC transponder when interrogated on Mode C at a sufficient number of test points to ensure the altitude reporting equipment, altimeters, and ATC transponders perform their intended functions as installed in the aircraft. The difference between the automatic reporting output and the altitude displayed at the altimeter must not exceed 125 ft (38.1 m).

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix D to GACAR Part 43 - Altimeter System Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: (d) Records. Comply with the provisions of GACAR § 43.11 as to content, form, and disposition of the records. The person performing the altimeter tests must record on the altimeter the date and maximum altitude to which the altimeter has been tested and the persons approving the aircraft for return to service must enter that data in the aircraft log or other permanent record.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: The ATC transponder tests required by GACAR § 91.453 may be conducted using a bench check or portable test equipment and must meet the requirements prescribed in paragraphs (a) through (j) of this appendix. If portable test equipment with appropriate coupling to the aircraft antenna ystem is used, operate the test equipment for ATC Radar Beacon System (ATCRBS) transponders at a nominal rate of 235 interrogations per second to avoid possible ATCRBS interference. Operate the test equipment at a nominal rate of 50 Mode S interrogations per second for Mode S. An additional 3 dB loss is allowed to compensate for antenna coupling errors during receiver sensitivity measurements conducted in accordance with paragraph (c)(1) of this appendix when using portable test equipment.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(1) For all classes of ATCRBS transponders, interrogate the transponder and verify the reply
frequency is 1 090 ±3 Megahertz (MHz).

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(2) For classes 1B, 2B, and 3B Mode S transponders, interrogate the transponder and verify the
reply frequency is 1 090 ±3 MHz.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(3) For classes 1B, 2B, and 3B Mode S transponders incorporating the optional 1090 ±1 MHz
reply frequency, interrogate the transponder, and verify the reply frequency is correct.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(4) For classes 1A, 2A, 3A, and 4 Mode S transponders, interrogate the transponder and verify
the reply frequency is 1 090 ±1 MHz.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(b) Suppression: When Classes 1B and 2B ATCRBS Transponders, or Classes 1B, 2B, and 3B ModeS transponders are interrogated Mode 3/A at an interrogation rate between 230 and 1 000
interrogations per second; or when Classes 1A and 2A ATCRBS Transponders, or Classes 1B, 2A,
3A, and 4 Mode S transponders are interrogated at a rate between 230 and 1 200 Mode 3/A
interrogations per second--

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(1) Verify the transponder does not respond to more than 1 percent of ATCRBS interrogations
when the amplitude of P2 pulse is equal to the P1 pulse.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(2) Verify the transponder replies to at least 90 percent of ATCRBS interrogations when the amplitude of the P2 pulse is 9 dB less than the P1 pulse. If the test is conducted with a radiated
test signal, the interrogation rate must be 235 ±5 interrogations per second unless a higher rate
has been approved for the test equipment used at that location.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: (c) Receiver Sensitivity:

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(1) Verify for any class of ATCRBS Transponder, the receiver minimum triggering level (MTL) of
the system is -73 ±4 dBm, or that for any class of Mode S transponder the receiver MTL for Mode
S format (P6 type) interrogations is -74 ±3 dBm by use of a test set either--

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: (i) Connected to the antenna end of the transmission line;

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(ii) Connected to the antenna terminal of the transponder with a correction for transmission
line loss; or

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: (iii) Used radiated signal.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(2) Verify the difference in Mode 3/A and Mode C receiver sensitivity does not exceed 1 dB for
either any class of ATCRBS transponder or any class of Mode S transponder.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT: (d) Radio frequency (RF) peak output power:

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(1) Verify the transponder RF output power is within specifications for the class of transponder.
Use the same conditions as described in paragraphs (c)(1)(i), (ii), and (iii) of this appendix.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(i) For Class 1A and 2A ATCRBS transponders, verify the minimum RF peak output power
is at least 21.0 dBW (125 W).

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(ii) For Class 1B and 2B ATCRBS Transponders, verify the minimum RF peak output power
is at least 18.5 dBW (70 W).

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(iii) For Class 1A, 2A, 3A, and 4, and those Class 1B, 2B, and 3B Mode S transponders that
include the optional high RF peak output power, verify the minimum RF peak output power
is at least 21.0 dBW (125 W).

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(iv) For Classes 1B, 2B, and 3B Mode S transponders, verify the minimum RF peak output
power is at least 18.5 dBW (70 W).

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(v) For any class of ATCRBS or any class of Mode S transponders, verify the maximum RF
peak output power does not exceed 27.0 dBW (500 W).                                                                                                        Note: The tests in paragraphs (e) through (j) of this appendix apply only to Mode S transponders.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(e) Mode S diversity transmission channel isolation: For any class of Mode S transponder
incorporating diversity operation, verify the RF peak output power transmitted from the selected
antenna exceeds the power transmitted from the nonselected antenna by at least 20 dB.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(f) Mode S Address: Interrogate the Mode S transponder and verify it replies only to its assigned
address. Use the correct address and at least two incorrect addresses. The interrogations should be made at a nominal rate of 50 interrogations per second.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(g) Mode S formats: Interrogate the Mode S transponder with uplink formats (UF) for which it is
equipped and verify the replies are made in the correct format. Use the surveillance formats UF = 4 and 5. Verify the altitude reported in the replies to UF = 4 are the same as that reported in a valid ATCRBS Mode C reply. Verify the identity reported in the replies to UF = 5 are the same as that reported in a valid ATCRBS Mode 3/A reply. If the transponder is so equipped, use the communication formats UF = 20, 21, and 24.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(h) Mode S all-call interrogations: Interrogate the Mode S transponder with the Mode S only
all-call format UF = 11, and the ATCRBS/Mode S all call formats (1.6 μs P4 pulse) and verify the
correct address and capability are reported in the replies (downlink format DF = 11).

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(i) ATCRBS Only All Call Interrogation: Interrogate the Mode S transponder with the ATCRBS only
all call interrogation (0.8 μs P4 pulse) and verify no reply is generated.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(j) Squitter: Verify the Mode S transponder generates a correct squitter approximately once per
second.

SUBPART HEADING: Appendix E to GACAR Part 43 - ATC Transponder Test and Inspection
REGULATION STATEMENT:
(k) Records: Comply with the provisions of GACAR § 43.11 as to content, form, and disposition of
the records.
